metadata.title: Accessibility Improvements - Keyboard Navigation and Screen Readers

story.iWant: ditto to be fully usable with keyboard navigation and screen readers
story.soThat: I can access all features regardless of how I interact with the web

tasks.task: Semantic HTML Audit and Enhancement Audit app layout (layout.tsx) for semantic landmarks: ensure main, nav, header wrapping is correct Ensure Sidebar uses nav element with aria-label="Main navigation" Ensure ResponsiveHeader uses header element with proper role Wrap page content areas in main id="main-content" with role="main" Replace non-semantic div wrappers with section, article, header, footer where appropriate in detail pages Verify heading hierarchy (h1 → h2 → h3) on all pages - ensure single h1 per page, no skipped levels Test: Run axe DevTools on each page to verify landmark structure

Skip Navigation Link Add visually-hidden "Skip to main content" link as first focusable element in the root layout Style with sr-only focus:not-sr-only pattern: hidden by default, visible and styled on keyboard focus Link targets #main-content anchor on the main content wrapper Test: Verify Tab from page load focuses skip link first, Enter navigates to main content

Keyboard Navigation Enhancement Audit all custom interactive elements (FAB, MobileAppCard, InterviewCardList, status dropdowns) for keyboard operability Ensure FAB button is keyboard accessible with Enter/Space activation and has proper focus order Ensure NavSheet items are keyboard navigable (Tab through items, Enter to select, Escape to close) Verify modal focus trap: Dialog, Sheet, and BottomSheet components trap focus inside when open, restore focus to trigger on close Ensure Escape key closes all overlays (modals, dropdowns, sheets, notification dropdown, search overlay) Verify data table rows are keyboard navigable (Tab to interactive elements within rows, Enter to navigate to detail) Ensure rich text editor (TipTap) toolbar is keyboard accessible with Tab/Arrow key navigation between toolbar buttons Test: Navigate entire app using keyboard only on all pages

Focus Indicator Styling Audit current focus styles across all interactive elements Define consistent focus ring style: focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 Apply focus-visible styles to all custom interactive elements that don't inherit from shadcn/ui primitives Ensure focus styles are visible in both light and dark modes with sufficient contrast Remove any outline-none without replacement focus-visible styles Test: Tab through all pages verifying every interactive element shows visible focus indicator

Color Contrast Audit and Fix Run contrast audit on all pages in light mode Run contrast audit on all pages in dark mode Fix any text that fails 4.5:1 ratio for normal text Fix any large text that fails 3:1 ratio Check status badges for contrast compliance Check placeholder text contrast Verify color is not the sole means of conveying information Test: Re-run contrast audit to confirm all violations fixed

ARIA Labels for Icon-Only Buttons and Dynamic Content Audit all icon-only buttons and add aria-label Add aria-label to icon-only navigation items in NavSheet and Sidebar Add aria-live="polite" to auto-save status indicator Add aria-live="polite" to notification count badge updates Ensure toast notifications (sonner) are announced to screen readers Add aria-expanded to collapsible sections Add aria-current="page" to active navigation item in Sidebar and NavSheet Test: Use screen reader to verify all icon buttons are announced with descriptive labels

Form Label Association and Accessibility Audit all forms: application, interview, assessment, submission, login/register, settings, search, filter inputs Ensure every input has an associated label For inputs with visible labels, verify htmlFor/id pair For visually-hidden labels (icon inputs, search), use sr-only label or aria-label Add aria-required="true" to required form fields Add aria-describedby linking inputs to their error message elements Test: Click on labels and verify they focus the associated input

Form Validation Error Announcements Add aria-invalid="true" to inputs that have validation errors Add role="alert" or aria-live="polite" to validation error message containers Ensure inline error messages have unique IDs referenced by aria-describedby Verify react-hook-form error rendering includes proper ARIA attributes Test: Submit forms with invalid data using screen reader, verify errors are announced

Accessibility Testing and Verification Run axe DevTools automated audit on all pages Fix all Critical and Serious axe violations Perform full keyboard-only navigation test on all pages Test with screen reader: login flow, create application, view application detail, create interview, navigate timeline Run Lighthouse accessibility audit and achieve score >= 90 Verify all fixes work in both light and dark modes Run npm run build to verify no TypeScript errors introduced

acceptanceCriteria.ac: All interactive elements keyboard accessible (Tab, Enter, Escape) without requiring a mouse (NFR-4.3)
Semantic HTML5 elements used throughout (nav, main, article, section, header, footer, button) for proper screen reader interpretation
All form inputs have properly associated labels via htmlFor/id or wrapping label, and error messages linked via aria-describedby
All text meets WCAG AA contrast ratios: 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text in both light and dark modes
Visible, consistent focus rings on all interactive elements during keyboard navigation; no focus indicator suppression
"Skip to main content" link at top of page, visible on keyboard focus, bypasses sidebar/header navigation
Icon-only buttons have descriptive aria-label; dynamic content regions use aria-live regions
Validation errors use aria-invalid on inputs and role="alert" or aria-live="polite" so screen readers announce errors automatically

doc.title: Frontend Architecture

doc.title: Architecture Document
doc.snippet: React Hook Form + Zod for client-side validation, Go struct tags for server-side. All components use Radix UI which provides keyboard navigation, focus management, and ARIA attributes built-in.

constraints.constraint: Enhance, don't rebuild. shadcn/ui + Radix UI already provides most accessibility primitives. Focus on: ensuring custom components match the same standard, adding missing ARIA labels and landmarks, fixing contrast issues in the theme, adding skip navigation, verifying full keyboard and screen reader experience.

Audit-first approach: Run axe DevTools on every page first to identify all violations, categorize by severity (Critical > Serious > Moderate > Minor), fix in severity order, re-run audit to confirm fixes.
Focus ring pattern: focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 as the standard for custom interactive elements.
Skip link pattern: sr-only focus:not-sr-only focus:absolute focus:z-50 focus:p-4 focus:bg-background focus:text-foreground focus:border focus:rounded-md

SSR safety: useBreakpoint initial state is undefined to prevent hydration mismatch. Accessibility enhancements must also be SSR-safe (no conditional rendering based on client-only state that would cause hydration errors).
Known issue: Mobile filter sheet flicker - do not modify filter sheet state management in this story.
Tailwind CSS v4 with focus-visible: prefix for focus styles (only shows on keyboard navigation, not mouse click). Use sr-only utility for visually-hidden content.

shadcn/ui components are in frontend/src/components/ui/ and can be modified directly. Radix UI primitives handle focus trapping, keyboard navigation, and ARIA attributes internally - verify these work rather than reimplementing.
Only write comments that explain WHY, not WHAT the code is doing. Code should be self-documenting.
Deferred from 6.3: inputMode/autoComplete attributes not yet added to form inputs. Consider adding aria-required and proper labeling as part of this story's form accessibility work.

tests.standards: This story uses manual accessibility testing as the primary verification method. axe DevTools browser extension for automated WCAG violation detection on all pages. Manual keyboard-only navigation testing (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Escape, Arrow keys) across every page. Screen reader testing with VoiceOver (macOS) or NVDA for critical user flows. WebAIM Contrast Checker for color contrast verification. Lighthouse accessibility audit targeting score >= 90. All fixes must be verified in both light and dark themes. No automated test framework (Jest/RTL) is set up yet; validation is manual + axe + Lighthouse.

ideas.idea: Keyboard-only navigation test: Tab through every page verifying all interactive elements (buttons, links, inputs, dropdowns, cards) are reachable and operable without a mouse
axe DevTools landmark audit: Verify each page has proper landmark structure (main, nav, header) with no duplicate main landmarks
Form label test: Click every label to verify it focuses the correct input. Screen reader should announce label when input receives focus

Contrast audit with WebAIM: Check all text colors against backgrounds in both light (--background: 0 0% 100%) and dark (--background: 204 7% 13%) themes. Pay special attention to muted-foreground colors
Focus indicator test: Tab through app and verify every interactive element shows a visible focus ring. Check that focus ring is visible on both light and dark backgrounds
Skip link test: Reload page, press Tab once - skip link should appear. Press Enter - focus should move to main content area, bypassing sidebar/header
Screen reader icon button test: Navigate to each icon-only button and verify screen reader announces descriptive label (e.g., "Open navigation menu", "Notifications", "Close")
Form error announcement test: Submit forms with invalid data while using screen reader. Verify error messages are announced automatically when they appear
